title: Kenya: We Have No Faith in KQ Management, Says Pilot Group
text:
South Africa: Transport Dept Failed Putco Drivers - Satawu 
Karauri said the airline fired 10 senior members in the guise of early retirement, straining relations with the pilot fraternity. 
"We invited the Labour ministry for conciliation talks that have since deadlocked, as a result the management sort and obtained a court order restraining Kalpa from taking industrial action," he said. 
"To add salt to injury, the management has decided to terminate the employment of some of our junior pilots on flimsy and unjustifiable grounds in a bid to intimidate and frustrate the pilots union." 
Karauri accused the airline of denying pilots leave yet claiming it has a surplus, adding that some have not taken time off in two years. 
He said Kalpa views KQ's "punitive" measures against pilots as "extremely provocative". Kenya
